meanings.sent1: She showed her gullibility by falling for the same scam twice.
meanings.sent2: His gullibility made him an easy target for con artists.
meanings.sent3: Her gullibility in believing the fake treasure map led to a funny adventure.
meanings.sent4: The gullibility of the villagers allowed the cunning fox to steal their food.
meanings.sent5: The magician used her gullibility to make the illusion seem real.

meanings.definition: A tendency to believe things too easily.
meanings.sent1: His gullibility was evident when he trusted strangers without question.
meanings.sent2: The salesman took advantage of her gullibility to sell overpriced products.
meanings.sent3: The gullibility of the puppy believing the toy was real was adorable.
meanings.sent4: Her gullibility was like a magnet for conspiracy theories.
meanings.sent5: The gullibility of the crowd led to chaos when they believed the false alarm.
